columns.text: This task asks **to determine the price of the Yan Yan Corp. bond.**

We should calculate the future payment of the bond, discounted at the time zero (now). The bond payment will be twice per year(semiannually), but we have an annual coupon rate and YTM. That is why we should divide the YTM and the coupon rate by two. A period is given annually, but we should multiply it by two. The bondholder will not get payments 13 times, but 26 (two times per year).

The givens are the following:

| | | 
|--|--| 
| Coupon rate | 4.4%| 
|Frequency |Semiannually | 
|Maturity | In 13 years | 
| Yield to maturity |4.8% | 
| Par value |$2,000 |

Let's adjust the coupon rate.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{semiannual coupon rate}&=\dfrac{\text{annual coupon rate}}{2}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{4.4\%}{2}\\[15pt]
&=2.2\%
\end{aligned}$$

The semi-annual coupon rate is 2.2\%.

Let's calculate the value of the coupon with the new coupon rate.
Coupon rates are determined by the entity that issues a bond. The coupon value will be the same for every future payment. So it is a fixed amount.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{coupon value}=&\text{coupon rate}\times\text{Face value}\\[15pt]
&=2.2\%\times\$2,000\\[15pt]
&=\$44
\end{aligned}$$

The coupon value is \$44.

Let's adjust the YTM.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{semiannual YTM}&=\dfrac{\text{annual YTM}}{2}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{4.8\%}{2}\\[15pt]
&=2.4\%
\end{aligned}$$

The semi-annual YTM is 2.4\%

Let's adjust the period.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{semiannual periods}&=\text{years}\times2\\[15pt]
&=13\times2\\[15pt]
&=26
\end{aligned}$$

We should consider 26 periods.

Now we have all adjusted data to solve the requirement.

$$\text{Price}=\text{C}\times\dfrac{1-\left(1+\text{YTM}\right)^\text{-n}}{\text{YTM}}+\dfrac{\text{P}}{\left(1+\text{YTM}\right)^\text{n}}$$

C-coupon of the bond 

YTM-yield to maturity

P-par value

n-time

Let's insert the data in the previous formula.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Price}&=\$44\times\dfrac{1-\left(1+2.4\%\right)^{-26}}{2.4\%}+\dfrac{\$2,000}{\left(1+2.4\%\right)^{26}}\\[15pt]
&=\$44\times19.17+\$1,079.521\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\$1,923.293}
\end{aligned}$$

**The price of the bond is \$1,923.293.**
